answers.answer: go to the hospital.  Better safe than sorry.blurred vision, trouble with blood pressure, heartrate, nausea, breathing trouble, passing out...Preeclampsia or toxemia?  dangerous.  I had this trouble with my first child.  I also had EXTREME swelling, chest pains & protein in my urine in addition to your symptoms.  I was kept in the hospital on & off on bed rest to moniter me & baby.  they were afraid I was going to have a seizure or something.Go to the hospital.  I hope it is a false alarm, but you don't want to find out later that you should have gone.  Go.  Go now please.
You should go to the hospital. It could be pre-eclampsia which is very dangerous to you and baby. I agree 100% with the above poster. Good luck.
I agree.  Hope you went and everything is okay!

question: I'm 34 weeks and today have been having bp ranging from 131/74 down to 110/54 with heart rate 110 or higher. I can barely breath and passed out once already. My head has so much pressure on it and I keep getting these surges of pain through my back followed by extreme nausea. I can feel pressure pushing down from the baby and having blurred vision and I feel so out of it and confused. I am already on bed rest due to elevated bp and have been resting all day. My OB's office isn't open till Tuesday and it's Sunday. What should I do?
title: Should I go to the hospital or wait till my OB is in?
